graph_title: 기능적인 문해 능력이 최소 일정 수준에 도달한 성 형평성 지수
indicator_name: 교육지표에 대한 형평지수(성, 도농, 소득분위, 장애상태, 원주민, 분쟁영향 여부별)
target_name: 2030년까지 교육에서의 성차를 해소하고, 장애인, 토착민, 취약상황에 처한 아동을 포함한 취약계층이 모든 수준의 교육과 직업훈련에 평등하게 접근

en.target: By 2030, eliminate gender disparities in education and ensure equal access to all levels of education and vocational training for the vulnerable, including persons with disabilities, indigenous peoples and children in vulnerable situations
en.indicator_name: Parity indices (female/male, rural/urban, bottom/top wealth quintile and others such as disability status, indigenous peoples and conflict-affected, as data become available) for all education indicators on this list that can be disaggregated
en.national_indicator_description: This indicator is defined as the ratio of the value of the underlying indicator (e.g. 4.1.1)  for one sub-group to that of another. Typically, the value for the likely more disadvantaged  group is the numerator. A value of exactly 1 indicates parity between the two groups although,  for analytical purposes, values between 0.97 and 1.03 are typically assumed to be at parity.
en.un_custodian_agency: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO)
en.global_metadata_text: United Nations Sustainable Development Goals Metadata (PDF 202 KB)
en.graph_title: Gender parity index achieving at least a fixed level of proficiency in functional literacy skills
en.source_organisation_1: United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization Institute for Statistics (UNESCO-UIS)
en.source_url_text_1: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (UIS) - Sustainable Development Goal 4
en.title: Untitled
en.page_content: ▶ Data type: Estimated data by international organizations (Type2) This is Korean data prepared by international organizations through estimation and modeling. If there are no national data corresponding to UN SDGs indicators, international data are available for monitoring.
